executiveSummary: Entrepreneurs Adam Kalan and Matt Campbell pitched BottleKeeper, an insulated container that keeps bottled beer cold and protected, seeking $1 million for 5% equity. After initial skepticism over the high valuation, they secured a joint royalty-based deal with two sharks for $1 million, offering 5% equity and a $1.50 per-unit royalty until the sharks recoup $1.5 million.
keyDecisions: Agreement reached on a $1 million investment deal with two sharks for 5% equity and a $1.50 per-unit royalty until $1.5 million is repaid.

actionItems.task: Finalize and formalize the investment and royalty agreement terms with the sharks.
Prepare for retail expansion leveraging the new strategic partnership and investment.
Continue managing marketing spend efficiently to maintain profitability while scaling.

nextSteps: BottleKeeper founders will proceed to finalize the deal with the sharks and use the capital to support retail distribution and brand growth.
